intro: Sasamorpha borealis var. angustior, commonly known as the narrowleaf northern sasamorpha, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its slender, lance-shaped leaves are a distinguishing feature, and it produces small white to pale yellow flowers in late summer. This variant is noted for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and small herbivores.
